creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture; formerly given to the Center by H. Ed Robison, in memory of his beloved wife Ulrike Pietzner Robison
description: a group of young men (wearing light clothing) and women (in blue and white summer kimono) attempt to skim goldfish out of an elevated pond with white nets while others gather on all sides to look on; at LL, a collection of potted plants and a basket of goods
marks:
Signature, Marks, and inscription

L margin, Jap LRC: [ よし田 ] {Yoshida}
medium: Woodblock print; ink and color on paper
title: Twelve Scenes of Tokyo: Dipping for Goldfish
